explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of support vector machines, a machine learning algorithm, for credit risk assessment.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper explicitly mentions that support vector machines are a supervised learning algorithm used in credit risk management.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on improving the performance of classifiers, specifically support vector machines, for credit risk assessment.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper proposes an ensemble support vector machine model for risk assessment in supply chain finance.
explanations.SVM: SVM is an abbreviation for support vector machine, which is the main algorithm discussed in the paper.
explanations.clustering: The paper uses fuzzy clustering as part of a noise filtering scheme to improve the performance of the classifier.
explanations.principal components analysis: The paper mentions the use of principal component analysis algorithm as part of a noise filtering scheme to remove attribute noise and class noise.
